summary: Two transitive dependencies in loader-utils (CVE-2022-37601 and CVE-2022-37599) were detected with a maximum CVSS severity of 9.8. The prototype pollution vulnerability in loader-utils 1.4.0 was flagged through the dependency chain and automatically resolved as part of dependency updates.
userImpact: Users of the SDK could be exposed to prototype pollution attacks and denial of service if the vulnerable transitive dependencies were not updated.
rootCause: istanbul-instrumenter-loader@3.0.1 depends on loader-utils@1.4.0 which contains CVE-2022-37601 (prototype pollution) and CVE-2022-37599 (ReDoS) vulnerabilities.
proposedFix: Upgrade loader-utils to version 2.0.0 or later to address both CVE-2022-37601 and CVE-2022-37599.
resolutionDetails: Issue was automatically closed by Mend because the vulnerable library was either marked as ignored or is no longer part of the Mend inventory, indicating dependency updates resolved the vulnerability.
keyQuote: Prototype pollution vulnerability in function parseQuery in parseQuery.js in webpack loader-utils 2.0.0 via the name variable in parseQuery.js.
